description:
'''Hayden Silas Anhedönia''' (born March 24, 1998), known professionally as '''Ethel Cain'''{{Efn|This article uses the name Ethel Cain when referring to the fictional character portrayed in her studio albums, and Hayden Anhedönia when referring to the singer/living person.|name=names}}{{Efn|While Ethel Cain is her main project, Anhedönia has had other projects under different monikers, such as '''Atlas''', '''Miss Anhedönia''', '''Tommy''', '''White Silas''', and '''אשמדאי'''.}}, is an American singer-songwriter, record producer, and model. Anhedönia is noted for her lyrics focused on nostalgic and [[Southern Gothic]] themes, while her music has been associated with the [[Ambient music|ambient]], [[indie rock]], and [[contemporary folk]] genres.

Anhedönia has released multiple recordings under various aliases before officially starting her main project in mid-2019. Three [[extended play]]s (EPs) preceded her debut studio album, ''[[Preacher's Daughter]]'', which was released in 2022 to acclaim from music critics—many of whom called it one of the best albums of the year. Following its release, she garnered a [[cult following]] online. Her standalone recording ''[[Perverts (album)|Perverts]]'' followed in January 2025. Anhedönia's second album, ''[[Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You]]'', serves as a [[prequel]] to the lyrical narrative of ''Preacher's Daughter'' and is scheduled to be released on August 8, 2025.
